intro: Androsace prattiana, commonly known as the alpine buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are usually succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Androsace prattiana is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
